dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An overcast sky. A dark truck cruises down the two-lane blacktop, passing hideous trailers. The pick-up slows as it nears a dirt road.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Broken radio. A cigarette pack rests in the cupholder. A camcorder sits in the passengerвЂ™s seat. CHRIS WHITEHEAD, 28, drugged-out neвЂ™er-do-well, handles wheel, feeling every bump the old road has to offer. His frenetic eyes stare out the windshield, searching for certain spot.

dialogues.speaker: LOUISE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: (whisper ) Chris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woods everywhere. Not a house in sight. Rampant weeds conquer the secluded yard. Empty bottles an cans scatter across the lawn. The truck pulls in. Chris steps out.

dialogues.speaker: LOUISE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Chris. Chris stumbles around, panicking.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Where are you? He stops, stunned. Chris sees LOUISE LEWTON, 16, innocent country girl, standing a few feet away. A torn dress covers her smooth skin. She glares at Chris, holding his gaze. ChrisвЂ™s eyes go blank. Hypnotized. He stares at Louise he needs her approval.

dialogues.speaker: LOUISE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m watching. Louise watches Chris undress. He pulls down his boxers. H naked, vulnerable. Leaning over, Chris grabs the camcorder. He places it on truckвЂ™s hood. The camcorderвЂ™s red record light glows.

dialogues.speaker: LOUISE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s your turn, Chris. Chris grabs a longneck off the ground. He SLAMS it agains the pick-up, SMASHING it into a million pieces. His blood hand grips a large shard.

dialogues.speaker: LOUISE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Do it, Chris. Facing Louise, he gets down on his knees.

dialogues.speaker: LOUISE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Do it for me. Chris opens his mouth. Raises the sharp piece of glass ov it. He slowly lowers the shard, the glass disappearing down h throat, going deeper and deeper. Louise watches him with merciless eyes. Blood trickles down ChrisвЂ™s mouth as he stares at her. gags, WHEEZING up blood. One final shove. Like a spear, the glass protrudes out th back of ChrisвЂ™s neck. He collapses to the ground. Convulses. Blood flows around the lodged shard, running through the tall grass. All the while, the unrelenting camera records the grisly scene. Chris goes still, lifeless. His body lies in the yard, all alone. Louise is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Afternoon. The sun struggles to break through. A Honda zips down the desolate road.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Messy, cramped. An early-2000s pop SONG plays on the radi VIVIEN TRACY, 33, elegant yet headstrong, sits behind the wheel. Her husband JAMIE, 28, scrawny introvert, slouches over in the passengerвЂ™s seat. VivienвЂ™s cell phone lies in the cupholder. A flamboyant flyer hangs out of her purse: Welcome back, Class of 2006 Gazing out the window, Vivien admires all of the local farmland.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s gorgeous. Jamie glances at the fields, unimpressed.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Looks the same. Vivien grabs her phone and checks the GPS. Ten miles from their destination.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: You know you donвЂ™t have to do this. Vivien looks at him, a little confused.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: What do you mean? Jamie shifts in his seat.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Coming here. ItвЂ™s not your reunion. She rests her hand on his leg.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Babe, I want to.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Naw, IвЂ™m serious. LetвЂ™s just go to Florida or something. Fuck all this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: What? ItвЂ™s a better idea, donвЂ™t you think?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: What would we tell everybody? Sarah, Casey.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Invite them to go with us! ItвЂ™1ll be like Daytona.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: No, itвЂ™s too late.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Seriously, youвЂ™d pick Whigham over Daytona?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Not when you put it like that.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m telling you, youвЂ™re gonna be bored as fuck. This townвЂ™s nothing.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s where you grew up!

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Sadly. Like an excited tourist, Vivien points toward a herd of cattle grazing in a wide field.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Look at it! ItвЂ™s so pastoral.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: "Pastoral?"

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Peaceful. Grinning, Jamie points her toward a dilapidated shack.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Yeah, thatвЂ™s some "pastoral" shit right there. Vivien gives him a soft punch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerk.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Look, itвЂ™s a waste, IвЂ™m telling you.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: No, itвЂ™s not.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Trust me.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: YouвЂ™re not even giving it a chance.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Why would I?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Well. I think itвЂ™1l be good for us. Jamie groans as she squeezes his arm.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s a change of pace, something different.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Yeah. A change of pace, alright.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Besides, IвЂ™m a little curious.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: About what?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Maybe I want to know more about my mysterious husband.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m right here.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Like your past past. Like what you were like in high school.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: God, whoвЂ™d wanna know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do!

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: That shit should stay buried.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Oh my God. Whatever.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t wanna remember. Not like all these other losers thatвЂ™1l be roaming the place.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Well, let me find out.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: ThereвЂ™s nothing to know.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: The only time I ever heard anything was from your mom.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Stick with that version. Vivien wraps her arm around Jamie.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: This is going to be fun. ItвЂ™1ll be like solving a mystery.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Yikes.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: The enigmatic Jamie Tracy.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: "Enigmatic?"

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Strange, elusive. Like a riddle.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: You make me sound like a magician.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: And you sound like youвЂ™ve got something to hide. A flamboyant DJ chats over a TRACKвЂ™s final seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That oneвЂ™s going out to Marion whoвЂ™s in town for the reunion this weekend.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Like another wife.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Damn, you got me. Vivien laughs.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Keep those skeletons in the closet.

dialogues.speaker: DJ, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: HereвЂ™s another hot one for you, class of two-thousand-and-six. Straight out of the MySpace vaults. Another annoying mid-aughts SONG comes on. Vivien smiles, recognizing the catchy tune instantly.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Oh my God! She turns up the radio. Jamie groans.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Back from the dead.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: I love it! Jamie watches her groove to the beat, amused.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: This is gonna be a long trip.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Whatever. You know you like it.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Lies. Belting the awful lyrics, Vivien grabs JamieвЂ™s hand, serenading him. Jamie fakes a cringe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, boy. Vivien smiles and hits his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Come on, sing it with me.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Naw, I canвЂ™t compete with that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VivienвЂ™s Honda cruises past a thick forest. Like a morbid statue, Louise stands near a cluster of dyi trees, watching the car drive out of sight. EXT. CASEYвЂ™S HOUSE - FRONT YARD - DAY Trimmed hedges surround a large country home. Decorated walkway. Brick mailbox. Picture perfect. A squad car and flawless sports car sit out front. VivienвЂ™s Honda parks further away. Vivien opens the door and steps out. SARAH THORNTON, 28, beleaguered former beauty queen, rush up.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Hey, you made it! She greets Vivien with a hug.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: I know. ItвЂ™s been forever.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Too long, girl. Holding VivienвЂ™s purse, Jamie exits the Honda. CASEY, 28, washed-up alpha dog, SarahвЂ™s husband, walks toward him, a mischievous smirk on his face. He wears his police uniform with pride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice purse, "Janie."

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Really, Casey? Jamie plays it off. He hands the purse back to Vivien.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Thanks, man. Vivien gives him the keys.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s about time you came outta the closet. Jamie and Casey exchange a bromantic handshake. Sarah looks over at Vivien.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: HowвЂ™d you train him to do that?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: A lot of practice.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Looks like you made him your little bitch to me.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Come on, now.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Just saying.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: All that psychology.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: ThatвЂ™s her forte, right? Vivien notices the impressive house.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Wow. Jamie leads Casey to the trunk. Casey flashes Vivien a sm grin.  10.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: You like it?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s nice.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: (to Casey) DonвЂ™t take too much credit for it. She leans in toward Vivien.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: His dad forked over the down payment. Jamie opens the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Hey, it wasnвЂ™t that much! Sarah rolls her eyes, prompting a chuckle from Vivien. INT. CASEYвЂ™S HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - NIGHT A flat screen plays a muted slasher MOVIE. An auxiliary cord connects CaseyвЂ™s phone to a gigantic speaker, blasting mid-2000s rock TUNES. Longnecks and empty cans populate the long coffee table. small trash bin sits next to the table. Vivien and Jamie occupy a couch, Sarah on the other.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: IвЂ™ve been planning it for awhile.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: ThatвЂ™s awesome!

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Yeah, weвЂ™1l see.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You should totally do it. ThatвЂ™d be great.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: I know. ItвЂ™s been my dream.  11.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Hey, IвЂ™m banking on it too. Sarah laughs as Vivien hits him. Wearing a

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: IвЂ™ve gotten used to the luxuries of being a doctorвЂ™s husband.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Your sugar mama.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Gross.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Sugar mama? sloppy bathrobe, Casey enters.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s about time.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: (to Jamie) I always knew youвЂ™d make a good housewife. Vivien rubs JamieвЂ™s leg.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: The cub to my cougar. Casey plops down next to Sarah.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Thanks, "sugar mama."

dialogues.speaker: SARAH

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Surprise, surprise. Casey tosses a Ziploc bag to the table. Marijuana city. Jamie grabs it, excited.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Holy shit!  12.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Where the HellвЂ™d you get that?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Perks of the job. Relax. Sarah punches his chest.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Ow! Damn, Sarah.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Boy, are you crazy? You canвЂ™t be doing shit like that! Casey pulls out the coffee tableвЂ™s drawer. An exquisite glass pipe lurks inside.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: So what? Who cares?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I do!

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Yeah, not the smartest idea.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: YвЂ™all, no oneвЂ™s gonna miss it, alright. This shit was gathering dust.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Good point. Casey packs the bowl.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: You think IвЂ™d be dumb enough to get caught?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Uh, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: I mean thereвЂ™s nothing wrong with it.  13.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: There. You see.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Just as long as you share. Casey offers his fist.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: My man! Jamie completes the fistbump.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH

dialogues.speaker: CASEY

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: No oneвЂ™s wanting it, no oneвЂ™s gonna miss it. Lifting a lighter, he ignites the cannabis.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Ugh. He inhales. Coughs like a first-timer.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Reunion pot. Nice. Casey holds it toward Sarah. With reluctance, she obliges

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Exactly. Janie gets it.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s Jamie, man. Sarah hits it. A violent cough.  14.

dialogues.text: So is that like a high school thing?

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: "Janie?" Like a bully, Casey chuckles with glee.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Oh shit.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE

dialogues.text: Fits like a glove.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Hey, fuck you, man.

dialogues.text: Yo, you brought it on yourself, bro. Sarah hands the pipe to Vivien. Trying to be polite, Vivien declines.

dialogues.text: That doesnвЂ™t mean it has to follow me for fifteen years.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: (to Sarah) I really shouldnвЂ™t.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: (muttering) Shithead.  15.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: This is the real shit. Deadass serious.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: She doesnвЂ™t have to. CaseyвЂ™s pressuring makes Vivien reconsider. She eyes th pipe.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: (annoyed) Casey. Jamie looks at Vivien.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: If you donвЂ™t want to, itвЂ™s--

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Let her make up her own mind, "Jamie." Goddamn. Vivien chuckles. Jamie glares at Casey. Casey snatches the pipe from Sarah.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Here. He leans in toward Vivien, a little flirtation in the gesture.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: SheвЂ™s a big girl. Vivien flashes him a sly smile. She grabs it.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Yeah, there you go!  16.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY

dialogues.text: Dr. Dahlgren actually. Casey nods, a little awkward.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY

dialogues.text: whoo! Smiling, Vivien leans forward and coughs in JamieвЂ™s lap

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Oh shit! Jamie grins and rubs the back of VivienвЂ™s head.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Oh God. She hands it to Jamie.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Courtesy of Whigham Public Safety.

dialogues.text: Of course. Jamie inhales. He hacks. Hands the pipe back to Casey.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Janie the lightweight over here.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: I think thatвЂ™d make anyone a lightweight.  17.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: True. Jamie leans back, still struggling.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Jesus, Jamie. DonвЂ™t die on me, buddy.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: YouвЂ™re the cop.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: I ainвЂ™t performing CPR on no dude. Casey takes a hit. Vivien grabs a longneck off the table.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Well, whereвЂ™s this new school at? The gymnasium. Jamie glances at the television. The slasher flick features a nighttime sequence in a rura forest.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Yeah, itвЂ™s huge. On screen, Louise stands in a clearing, her eyes staring right at Jamie.

dialogues.text: (to himself) Fuck.

dialogues.text: ThatвЂ™s all high school is. Just one big cell for our dreams and aspirations.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Geez, you make it sound like a horror movie.  18. Louise steps toward the screen, holding JamieвЂ™s horrifi gaze.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t know. I work with all these kids and it kills them, it really does. The education systemвЂ™s so weak and when you combine that with bullying, peer pressure. It just makes it tough. Louise nears closer and closer.

dialogues.text: Maybe for some kids. He nods at the uneasy Jamie.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Like this guy. Sarah hits Casey.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH

dialogues.text: What? HeвЂ™s my best friend.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH

dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Jamie. Vivien tries to grab him. Jamie backs away, avoiding her touch.

dialogues.text: What is it? WhatвЂ™s wrong? She stands up.  19.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: You couldnвЂ™t have.

dialogues.text: Aw, God!

dialogues.text: Jamie.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: (to Jamie) ItвЂ™s okay. Louise lunges forward. Someone grabs CaseyвЂ™s arm. He jumps and turns. Sarah.  21.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Casey, relax.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Shit. Vivien rubs JamieвЂ™s back. Jamie looks back. No Louise. SheвЂ™s gone.

dialogues.text: Ugh. Casey.

dialogues.text: No, not at all.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: SheвЂ™s not dead. I saw her, I swear.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Jamie. I donвЂ™t know. Vivien strokes his worried face.  22.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m sorry. On screen, the woods scene continues. Masked Psychopath closes in on Blonde Bombshell. Their gloved hand raises a long knife.

dialogues.speaker: BATHROOM
dialogues.text: Bright lighting. Clean. A long mirror. A crammed magazine rack sits by the toilet. Casey rummages through the medicine cabinet, KNOCKING ove various bottles.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Come on. He finds what he was looking for: a small Ziploc bag. whi powder.

dialogues.speaker: HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Cluttered counters. Sarah navigates through the narrow ha

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Casey! She bumps into a counter. A framed photo of the couple on vacation TUMBLES to the floor. Sarah stumbles back, stepping on the glass, CRACKING it. looks down.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Shit. Sarah picks up the remnants and lays them on the counter. She hears a loud SNIFF. She looks at the bathroom door, her eyes full of fire.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You bastard!

dialogues.speaker: BATHROOM
dialogues.text: The enraged Sarah opens the door. Casey leans over the counter, ready to snort another whit line.  23.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Goddammit, Casey! He stops and stares at her.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Wait.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: No, fuck you! He reaches toward her.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Let me explain. Sarah storms out.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Sarah! He charges after her. She SLAMS the door in his face.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cool BREEZE whips through the towering trees. The uneasy Vivien walks amongst the high grass.

dialogues.speaker: ROB, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: (praying) I beg of you. Vivien looks around, searching for Rob.

dialogues.speaker: ROB, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: I canвЂ™t do this alone, Lord. EXT. LOUISEвЂ™S HOUSE - FRONT YARD - NIGHT Desolate, no neighbors. A clean lawn. Religious ornaments decorate the yard. Vivien emerges from the forest. She sees the log cabin.  24.

dialogues.speaker: ROB, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Forgive me. Please. INT. LOUISEвЂ™S HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - NIGHT Decadent crucifixes hang along the walls. An antique pian rests in the corner. A cozy fireplace. The muted T.V. plays a black-and-white film. Vivien pushes the front door open and staggers inside. He frantic eyes scan the room, but see no one.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Hello? She notices a portrait of Louise hanging over the firepla Like a starlet, Louise poses in the shot, looking so prop and regal.

dialogues.speaker: ROB, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Please, Lord. Vivien journeys through the rest of the room until she st in something sticky. She looks down. Moist blood.

dialogues.speaker: ROB, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Look after her in Heaven.

dialogues.speaker: DINING ROOM
dialogues.text: A gorgeous chandelier provides bright lighting. The long dinner table lines up, two chairs seated at each end. Vivien enters, her nervous steps CREAKING on the wooden floor. She sees ROB LEWTON, 44, bearded holy roller, sitting at head of the table, weeping, his face turned away.

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: Protect her. Vivien approaches him.

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: Protect my baby girl. He lowers his hand, revealing a blood-stained butcher kni The terrified Vivien stops right next to him.  25.

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: ThatвЂ™s all, Lord. Vivien reaches toward him.

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: Protect Louise. Rob snatches her hand.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Oh God! He looks up at her, his eyes full of despair.

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: YouвЂ™ve gotta believe me! Breaking away, Vivien trips and falls to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: I didnвЂ™t do it! The dazed Vivien turns. She screams in horror. LouiseвЂ™s dead eyes stare right back at her. Blood flows her slit throat, the thick redness sliding down her body, spreading throughout her dress. Rob stands up, shoving his chair back.

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: I didnвЂ™t kill my baby! Louise leans upright. Blood DRIPS off her fatal wound, SPLASHING to the floor. Vivien crawls back.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: No! Rob glances down at the knife. He clutches the wooden handle. Closes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: Protect me, Lord. Give me strength. Louise reaches toward Vivien. Vivien stumbles to her feet and turns, just avoiding LouiseвЂ™s hand. Rob YELLS and lurches forward, ensnaring Vivien in his ar  26.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: The Good Lord will look after me! Rob raises the sharp blade.

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: HeвЂ™1l1 look after us all!

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: No, donвЂ™t do this! He THRUSTS the knife into VivienвЂ™s stomach.

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: Protect us, Lord! She screams as he JAMS the blade into her fragile flesh o and over. INT. CASEYвЂ™S HOUSE - GUEST ROOM - NIGHT Two windows showcase the manicured lawn. Casey and Sarahв portrait hangs over a trophy case. Useless awards from th far-too-distant past. Vivien awakens from her nightmare. Breathing heavy, she checks her surroundings, making sure sheвЂ™s safe. No Rob knife, no Louise. Vivien looks over at the sleeping Jamie Her adrenaline dying down, she notices a collection of framed photos, all of them highlighting CaseyвЂ™s tenure high school baseball star. Some of the pics even show him with a nerdy, benchwarmer Jamie. Vivien cracks a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning dew drips from the trees. Crime scene tape surrounds the scene. A couple of police cars sit nearby. Several OFFICERS investigate. PARAMEDICS load ChrisвЂ™s corpse into an ambulance.  27. Standing in the middle of the yard, KANE THORNTON, 55, ja sheriff, glances over at Officer JASON EARLE, 25, smartas newbie. Like an arrogant photographer, Jason takes pictures of th blood-stained grass, having more fun than he should.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: (in disbelief) Completely naked. Not missing a beat, Jason leans in for a closer shot.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Yes sir. Naked as a jaybird.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ. Jason faces him.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: I got the glass in the car if you wanna see. Kane holds up his hand and steps away, heading for his ca

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: No thanks, Jason. I think IвЂ™ve had enough.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Suit yourself, Sheriff. Kane opens the door. He looks off toward the dirt road, l in thought. Jason inspects more blood spatter. Like a grisly finger painting, the splashes of redness spread all across the unkempt lawn.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Yes sir. I ainвЂ™t ever heard of no man getting naked before offing himself. He holds the camera steady. Kane remains quiet, an uneasy expression on his face.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Maybe a woman. I wouldnвЂ™t mind no crime scene like that now.  28. Forcing a laugh, Jason takes another shot.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Maybe next time yвЂ™all can call me for one of them bathtub suicides-- An engine CRANKS, interrupting Jason. He turns and watche Kane PULL AWAY. INT. CASEYвЂ™S HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - DAY Afternoon. Sarah, all dressed for the reunion, cleans up coffee table. She CRUSHES a beer can. Wearing a fresh blazer, Casey clutches a longneck and lea against the wall, watching her.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I told you to quit.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, itвЂ™s called stress. Maybe if you worked, youвЂ™d understand. The lackadaisical Casey takes a sip.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: The police officer in a hick town. So stressful and important. Sarah slings the can inside the trash bin.

dialogues.speaker: GUEST ROOM
dialogues.text: Vivien sits in front of the dresser mirror, putting on her make-up. Straightening his suit, Jamie leans in behind her, trying see his reflection. Vivien glances at him, impressed.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: You look good.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: You sound so convincing.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: No, IвЂ™m serious. Jamie steps away.  29.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah. Vivien turns around.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Can I ask you something? Jamie stops near the bed, confused.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Sure.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: What you saw last night. I mean-- Jamie avoids eye contact, a little flustered.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Aw, look, it was nothing, I promise you.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: You seemed upset.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Vivien. Vivien stands and approaches him.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: I could tell it was bothering you.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s not a big deal. Vivien stops in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: If it has something to do with your mom, we--

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: No, fuck no.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: I understand- -

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: It had nothing to do with that. Vivien grabs his arm.  30.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: I know how hard itвЂ™s been, Jamie. She was all you had. Jamie breaks away from her grasp.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Not anymore. IвЂ™ve moved on.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Jamie.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Look, just what are you trying to say? You think IвЂ™ve got some kindвЂ™ve fucked-up mommy complex or something.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: No! Babe, people react to these things in different ways. ItвЂ™s part of the grieving process.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Awesome. The great Dr. Vivien Dahlgren heals her husband.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m not saying itвЂ™d have to be with me, but thereвЂ™s nothing wrong with talking to somebody, Jamie! Society gives it such a stigma, but itвЂ™s normal. Jamie scoffs. Trying to

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: I promise it can help if youвЂ™d just give it a chance. Whatever feelings you have, you can be at peace with them. downplay the topic, Jamie caresses VivienвЂ™s face.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Vivien, I love you, and I know youвЂ™re just trying to help, but IвЂ™m not one of your patients. IвЂ™m fine.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Just keep it in mind, will you? Please. For me.  31.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Alright, IвЂ™11 think about it. How about that? Vivien wraps her arms around him.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: ThatвЂ™s all IвЂ™m asking. They kiss. Jamie smirks.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Why Dr. Dahlgren anyway? Why not Dr. Tracy? Vivien laughs.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: DonвЂ™t tell me youвЂ™re jealous?

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Maybe a little. He reaches inside his suit pocket.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: YouвЂ™re a real head case.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: I prefer "enigmatic."

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Fair enough. Jamie retrieves a jewelry box.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Oh. Jamie. He opens the box. A decadent necklace.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Oh my God!

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: You like it? Vivien kisses him.  32.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Yes, itвЂ™s beautiful! Vivien grabs the box. She holds up the necklace, enamored the beautiful jewelry.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Wow, where did you find this?

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Go on, put it on.

dialogues.speaker: UPSTAIRS HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Spacious. Generic paintings cover the walls. Casey and Jamie argue near a granddaddy clock. Casey wave the longneck around, spilling booze over his blazer.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: (failing at whispering) What the fuck were you thinking back there?

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m sorry, I--

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: We made a promise, remember?

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: I know, but I wasnвЂ™t lying.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Bullshit. Jamie leans in closer, nose-to-nose with Casey.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: I fucking saw her, man! She was in the house. Casey goes quiet. He takes a sip, his eyes wide and restless. Jamie notices his despondency.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Fuck. You saw her too, didnвЂ™t you? Casey looks around, paranoid.  33.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: You had to. I-- Casey pushes Jamie back.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: It was the dope.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: No, it wasnвЂ™t! It was Louise.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: That bitch is dead, Jamie!

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Yeah, cause of us! Casey slams Jamie against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Shut the fuck up!

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Casey. Like heвЂ™s wielding a dagger, Casey points the bottle at Jamie.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: That bitch ainвЂ™t ever coming back you hear me? Jamie offers a timid nod.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Just keep your fucking mouth shut.

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Sarah places CaseyвЂ™s pipe in the table drawer. A KNOCK at the front door distracts her.

dialogues.speaker: GUEST ROOM
dialogues.text: Sitting in front of the mirror, Vivien giggles as she readjusts her necklace. Glass BREAKS. The startled Vivien whirls around. She sees a framed phot on the dresser. A picture of Jamie and Casey in the dugou A large crack now runs across the frameвЂ™s glass, right the friendsвЂ™ faces.  34. Vivien stands up.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: What in the world? She grabs the photo. Traces her finger along the crack.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Casey!

dialogues.speaker: KITCHEN
dialogues.text: Empty beer cans and longnecks fill an overcrowded garbage can. Sarah throws a few more stragglers on top of the hea

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: SomebodyвЂ™s here! Another ferocious KNOCK. Groaning, Sarah goes to the door

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Ugh, nevermind!

dialogues.speaker: DOWNSTAIRS HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Sarah enters. Jamie and Casey descend the stairs, both of them silent. Sarah glances at them.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: YвЂ™all cleaned up nice. Ignoring her, Casey disappears inside the kitchen. Sarah looks at Jamie.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Sheesh, whatвЂ™s wrong with him? Jamie doesnвЂ™t answer as he stops in the hallway. Sarah opens the door. Kane. The sight makes Jamie bump into a counter.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Oh, hey, Mr. Thornton.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: My, Sarah, you look lovely.  35.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Thank you. She holds the door for him as he steps inside.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Come on in.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: I sure hate busting in like this. I know yвЂ™all been busy getting ready. Sarah shuts the door.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: No, youвЂ™re fine. Kane notices the nervous Jamie.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Hey there, son. Long time no see. Faking a smile, Jamie sticks his hand out.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: How are you, Sheriff?

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Been better. They shake hands. An awkward exchange.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: IвЂ™ve got some bad news, IвЂ™m afraid. Casey emerges from the kitchen. He TWISTS the top off of fresh longneck.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: WhatвЂ™s up, daddy? Kane looks at Casey. Subtle yet intense eye contact.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Where were you this morning? I done called you five times. Sarah glares at Casey.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Casey.  36.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: What? So we partied a little, I slept in. So what?

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Goddammit, son, this is serious. Casey cackles.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: In Whigham? wWhatвЂ™s the fucking emergency? Casey clasps JamieвЂ™s shoulder, feigning a good mood. Ja forces a smirk.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: I mean did the McKenziesвЂ™ yard get TPвЂ™d again?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: (aggravated) Casey. Vivien walks down the stairs and stops next to Jamie.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: You catch a couple of teenagers fucking on Green Creek?

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Son, we just found Chris Whitehead with a piece of glass jammed down his throat. Casey stumbles back, spilling beer. Vivien grabs JamieвЂ™s arm.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Oh no. Jamie stares at Kane, stunned by the news.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: You sure it was him? Kane offers a morose nod.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: His mama came and IDвЂ™ed him a little while ago.  37.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: What the fuck? ArenвЂ™t there any suspects? Why arenвЂ™t we out riding around?

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: It was a suicide.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Jesus! Chris whitehead?

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: The lab boys confirmed everything. Crazy son-of-a-bitch did it himself.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: ThatвЂ™s horrible. Kane steps toward the front door.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: I hate having to tell yвЂ™all like this when yвЂ™all are all ready to celebrate, have a good time. I guess I just remembered how tight yвЂ™all all used to be.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: God, I had no idea. I hadnвЂ™t talked to him in years. Vivien clutches JamieвЂ™s hand.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s okay. KaneвЂ™s harsh eyes lock in on Casey. INT. CASEYвЂ™S HOUSE - DOWNSTAIRS HALLWAY - DAY (LATER) Vivien looks out the window, watching Kane, Jamie, and Ca converse on the front porch. Sarah fixes the counter Jamie stumbled into earlier.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: So thatвЂ™s his daddy? Vivien faces Sarah.  38.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Yeah. HeвЂ™s nice once you get to know him. Sarah steps away.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I better finish getting ready.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Wait, Sarah. Sarah stops and turns. Vivien walks up to her, a little awkward.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Are things any better? Sarah goes silent.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: IвЂ™ve been meaning to ask. I hope I donвЂ™t seem nosy. Sarah displays a weak smile.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: No. ItвЂ™s part of your job, right?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: I just know itвЂ™s best to have someone to talk to. Glancing out the window, Sarah looks at Casey.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: He hasnвЂ™t changed. Sarah faces Vivien.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Just gotten worse.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Oh God. Sarah.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: He canвЂ™t even afford the phone payments. HeвЂ™s got his fucking daddy doing everything for him and pampering him. Sarah turns away, fighting back tears.  39. Vivien reaches toward her.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Sarah. Sarah avoids her.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: And he takes it all out on me! Sarah shows Vivien her arm. Brown bruises.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Oh God!

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: This is what he wants from me! He said itвЂ™s all IвЂ™m good for! That IвЂ™m just a worthless cunt!

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: No, youвЂ™re not, Sarah! YouвЂ™re so much better than that! Vivien rests her hand against SarahвЂ™s face.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: You canвЂ™t stay with him. Not when heвЂ™s like this. Sarah backs away.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I saw a lawyer and filed the papers and all, but I still havenвЂ™t told him. I canвЂ™t. IвЂ™m too scared.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: You have to. ItвЂ™s the only way.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: But where can I go? Look at me.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: YouвЂ™1l1 be fine.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I got no degree! No job! HeвЂ™s all IвЂ™ve got!

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: No, heвЂ™s not!  40.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I canвЂ™t go anywhere. Vivien holds SarahвЂ™s hand, a soothing touch.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: You can stay with us. Until you get on your own. Wiping away her tears, Sarah looks at Vivien, some hope i her wounded eyes.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Yes. WeвЂ™1l support you. I can help you find a job. WeвЂ™1l get you out of this once and for all.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Oh God. Thank you so much. She hugs Vivien. Vivien rubs her back.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s okay. YouвЂ™re going to be fine. Sarah looks at Vivien.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: IвЂ™11 tell him tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: HeвЂ™s never going to hurt you again. EXT. CASEYвЂ™S HOUSE - FRONT YARD - DAY The evening sunlight fades away. Jamie, Casey, and Kane argue on the porch. Sweat streams down the livid KaneвЂ™s face. Jamie stays quiet, withdraw

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Son.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Look, I already told you, daddy! I donвЂ™t fucking know.  41.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Be honest with me, Goddammit!

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: How the Hell am I supposed to know? I havenвЂ™t talked to that asshole in years.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: There had to be a reason.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Everybody knows his stupidass was fried on meth. The fuckerвЂ™s nuts!

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Goddammit, boy, itвЂ™s not just the suicide. ItвЂ™s how he was found.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Chris Whitehead was naked! He stripped himself down before doing this shit.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Well, that sounds a lot like Chris then.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: No, Goddammit! DonвЂ™t you remember that girlвЂ™s father? Casey laughs and turns away.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Fuck me. You too? Kane snatches CaseyвЂ™s shoulder, forcing Casey to face h

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: He did the same shit! We found him in the cell stark naked when he hanged himself. Casey breaks away from KaneвЂ™s grip.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Rob Lewton killed himself cause he killed that little bitch! Jamie stares at them, an uneasy expression on his face.  42.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: They never found the body.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: The boyвЂ™s right, Casey. Casey shoves Jamie.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Yo, shut the fuck up, Janie! YвЂ™all are both talking crazy! Rob did it! They found the knife. His fingerprints were all over it! Casey raises the bottle for another sip.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m not so sure. Startled, Casey lowers the longneck and glares at Kane.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: What the Hell are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: That crazy bastard couldnвЂ™t have hid the body on his own!

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: (a little uncertain) But the knife. It was a slam dunk.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: He was a Slam dunk scapegoat to shut the town up! I made sure of that!

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: No. Kane leans in closer.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Who do you think started the incest rumors, huh? Someone had to take the heat off of yвЂ™allвЂ™s sorryasses! Casey tosses the longneck toward the yard, HITTING a sprinkler.  43.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Bullshit!

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m telling yвЂ™all, stay away from that Goddamn reunion! Something ainвЂ™t right! Louise Lewton could still be out there! Jamie faces Casey.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t know, man, maybe heвЂ™s right. Casey scoffs in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Are yвЂ™all crazy? Chris was a fucking loser. It was only a matter of time before he turned up dead or went to jail.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Someone out there knows what yвЂ™all did. They know the truth. The angry Casey points at him.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Shut the fuck up! Kane gets in CaseyвЂ™s face.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: You better show me some respect, boy!

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: No, fuck you!

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Daddy canвЂ™t bail you out everytime! Casey slaps Kane. Kane grabs his cheek, startled by the move. The stunned Jamie stares at Casey. Casey seizes the momen exploiting his prowess.  44.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: YвЂ™all both need to get yвЂ™allвЂ™s shit together! The Lewtons are fucking dead! No oneвЂ™s ever gonna know the truth! Tense silence.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: I sure hope youвЂ™re right, son. Kane slides on his lawman shades.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: I really do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Potholes galore. Roadkill rots on the roadside. CaseyвЂ™s sports car ZOOMS past a bullet-riddled speed li sign. INT. CASEYвЂ™S SPORTS CAR - MOVING - NIGHT Meticulous, clean. All the signs of a devoted car owner. Casey controls the wheel, enjoying himself. Jamie and Viv occupy the backseat. Sitting in the passengerвЂ™s seat, Sarah leans over and c the speedometer. Well over seventy. Make-up now conceals dark bruises.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Geez, will you slow down? Casey takes out a cigarette pack.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: You sound like a granny. Sarah knocks the pack away.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Hey, what the fuck?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I told you to quit.  45.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: You didnвЂ™t say cigarettes, "dear."

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Y'all. Sarah groans and turns away.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Such an asshole.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: And youвЂ™re a fucking bitch so that makes us the perfect couple, right? Casey turns up the radio. Vivien grabs SarahвЂ™s shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: (whispering) Ignore him. A mid-2000s pop song BLARES. Vivien smiles after recogniz the tune.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Oh, leave it here! Casey pretends to change the station. Vivien leans forward.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: No, donвЂ™t! Sarah grabs CaseyвЂ™s hand. He chuckles, enjoying himself

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m just playing, yвЂ™all. Goddamn.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s hard to tell when youвЂ™re always being a douche.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Ditto. Vivien sings along to the lyrics, trying to drown out the bickering. The impressed Sarah listens, an audience of one.  46.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Yeah! Get it, girl! She high-fives Vivien. Casey holds his hand in the air, pretending to be a drunk rock fan. An easy acting job for him. Vivien turns and sees Jamie looking out the window, disappointed to not see him join in on the jovial fun. The old high school lurks up ahead. A deep forest surroun the crumbling, two-story building. Dirt and dying grass conquer what was once a paved driveway and parking lot. Egg stains plaster the dilapidated brick sign: Whigham Hi Casey points at the school as they pass by.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: YвЂ™all remember that beauty, donвЂ™t you? Vivien and Jamie stare at it, stunned.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Is that it?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Looks like shit.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Yeah, the new oneвЂ™s a lot better.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Ten years makes that much of a difference?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Hell yeah, girl. Jamie watches the school disappear out of sight.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Just look at us.  47.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A full parking lot. The large building looks exquisite and mighty, it and the neighboring school building the complete opposite of the decrepit old high school. ATTENDEES head for the entrance. Loud MUSIC blares from inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Countless stands contain wine bottles and snacks. Pop mus BLASTS over a sweet dance floor. Jamie and Vivien make their way through. Vivien notices the other attendees flashing cold glares a murmuring to themselves as the couple walk by. DOUCHEBAG PREP and BURNOUT PROM KING converse near a trop case.

dialogues.speaker: DOUCHEBAG PREP
dialogues.text: (drunk whisper ) Holy shit, is that him?

dialogues.speaker: BURNOUT PROM KING
dialogues.text: Yeah, what the fuckвЂ™s he doing here? Vivien looks at Jamie. He seems nonchalant about the chil reception as he leads her toward one of the decorated tables. Wine bottles, snack bowls. They stop at the end of the line. An ICY BLONDE and her LESS ATTRACTIVE FRIEND stand at the front of the table. They see Jamie, both of them reacting quick and snatching their drinks.

dialogues.speaker: ICY BLONDE
dialogues.text: LetвЂ™s go. They scurry off. Vivien grabs JamieвЂ™s hand. They exchange uneasy looks.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: I told you this was a bad idea.  48.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: DonвЂ™t say that. Jamie recognizes the guy waiting in front of them. AL PEC 27, conformist nerd.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Al? Al bites his lip. He turns around, forcing a shit-eating grin.

dialogues.speaker: AL
dialogues.text: Hey. Jamie. I thought that was you. Jamie holds his hand out.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: HowвЂ™ve you been, man? Al completes the weak exchange, eager to pull back.

dialogues.speaker: AL
dialogues.text: IвЂ™ve been doing alright. Jamie acknowledges Vivien.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: This is my wife Vivien. Al nods at her.

dialogues.speaker: AL
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s nice to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Oh, itвЂ™s nice to meet you too.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: This whole reunion stuff.

dialogues.speaker: AL
dialogues.text: Yeah, tripping you out too, huh?

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: So were yвЂ™all pals in high school?

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Yeah, I guess you could say that.  49.

dialogues.speaker: AL
dialogues.text: (cold tone) We were.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Oh. Al faces Jamie.

dialogues.speaker: AL
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s a real shame about Chris, huh?

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Yeah, it is.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: I didnвЂ™t know him, but it sounded terrible--

dialogues.speaker: AL
dialogues.text: I guess heвЂ™d been going down that wrong path for awhile. Like an aggressive detective, Al looks right into JamieвЂ eyes.

dialogues.speaker: AL
dialogues.text: Like a lot of us. Across the room, SCRAWNY FEMALE waves Al over. Jamie and Vivien notice her waves becoming more desperate

dialogues.speaker: AL
dialogues.text: Excuse me. He walks toward Scrawny Female, leaving Jamie and Vivien the lone attendees at the table.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Dickhead.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Yeah. The angry Jamie snatches a bottle. He pours two cups of wine. Vivien sees Al and Scrawny Female watching them.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: What a jerk.  50.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: I guess heвЂ™s just being honest. Vivien grabs JamieвЂ™s arm. He jumps, spilling some of th wine.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Forget about him, babe. YouвЂ™re better than that.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: I guess. Vivien loosens her grip. Jamie hands her a drink.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Now I see why you never come back. Jamie reveals a nervous smile.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: I told you.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Hey, there they are! Sarah and Casey approach the couple. RUDY GABLE, 28, chubby drunkard, stumbles behind them. Al of them hold drinks.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: (to Rudy) Oh, hello.

dialogues.speaker: RUDY
dialogues.text: WhatвЂ™s going on?

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Holy shit, Rudy!

dialogues.speaker: RUDY
dialogues.text: Yeah, dude. Rudy and Jamie exchange a bromantic handshake.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: We found him near the stage. Drunk bastard.

dialogues.speaker: RUDY
dialogues.text: Like always.  51.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: (to Rudy) This is my wife Vivien.

dialogues.speaker: RUDY
dialogues.text: Hey, nice catch, man. Vivien smiles, pleased to meet someone friendly.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Yeah, I got lucky. Casey glances around, taking note of all his unwelcoming peers.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: So yвЂ™all wanna get a table or something?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Uh, yes, please. Casey lifts a bottle off the table.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Casey! The laughing Rudy points at Casey.

dialogues.speaker: RUDY
dialogues.text: Still the same olвЂ™ Thornton!

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Still an asshole. Casey strong-arms her toward the back, leading the others

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Come on. The CROWD disperses around them, giving them a little too much space. Vivien grabs JamieвЂ™s hand, showing her support.  52.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darkness conquers the scene. A cool breeze SWAYS the crim scene tape. A squad car sits near the yard. Kane leans against the do on the driverвЂ™s side. He takes a swig from a longneck alleviating his nerves. He gazes toward the lot. Sees the spot where Chris killed himself. The dry blood. Kane shakes his head. One final sip empties the bottle. He chucks the longneck into a deep ditch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The friends have the corner all to themselves. A few empt wine bottles stand on top of their table. Sarah flips through a 2006 yearbook, checking out their senior portraits. Vivien looks on, her curiosity piqued. Rudy downs his cup before leaning back. He belches.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Puss. Rudy points at CaseyвЂ™s half-filled cup.

dialogues.speaker: RUDY
dialogues.text: Not like youвЂ™re doing much better.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Hey, IвЂ™m working on it, bitch. Sarah traces her finger over her model-level photo.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: God, we looked so good.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: I know. What happened to you?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Fuck you. Vivien sees JamieвЂ™s photo. Handsome yet gawky. She looks over at Jamie, meeting his eyes.  53.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Impressive, huh? She wraps her arm around him.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Not bad at all.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Yeah, I picked the wrong one. Typical.

dialogues.speaker: RUDY
dialogues.text: Ouch. With braggadocio, Casey points toward his photo: a seventeen-year-old who knows heвЂ™s good-looking, invinci and makes sure everyone knows it. An asshole.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Hey, nine out of ten women would make the same mistake. Casey downs his drink.

dialogues.speaker: RUDY
dialogues.text: And the other one out of ten?

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Hideous and blind.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Mama was right. Total mistake.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Moms usually are. Sarah turns the page. Senior Superlatives.

dialogues.speaker: RUDY
dialogues.text: Oh fuck!

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What? Knocking over a glass, the horrified Rudy covers up his Class Clown photo.

dialogues.speaker: RUDY
dialogues.text: DonвЂ™t look!  54.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Come on, itвЂ™s not that bad. Casey pushes RudyвЂ™s hand away.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Yeah, loosen up. Casey glances at the embarrassing photo. He chuckles with delight.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Oh shit! Goddamn. Sarah flashes him a death stare.

dialogues.speaker: RUDY
dialogues.text: Thanks, Thornton.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: You should sue the school over that.

dialogues.speaker: RUDY
dialogues.text: I think they made me look fatter on purpose. Sarah flips through the pages.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Well, at least you got one.

dialogues.speaker: RUDY
dialogues.text: Yeah. Too bad I couldnвЂ™t have one of the cooler ones.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Yeah, I shouldвЂ™ve won Best Looking.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Most Annoying. Sarah lands on the sophomore pictures. LouiseвЂ™s photo l in the corner. Innocent and pretty. Big eyes. Noticing it instantly, Rudy points at the image.

dialogues.speaker: RUDY
dialogues.text: Shit, that was her last one, wasnвЂ™t it?  55.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Yeah. Louise Lewton. The quiet Casey turns away.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: So what happened to her exactly? Jamie stares at the picture. LouiseвЂ™s eyes pierce right through his soul.

dialogues.speaker: RUDY
dialogues.text: ThatвЂ™s the thing. No one really knows. Casey glares at him.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Dude, donвЂ™t play that paranormal bullshit with me.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Casey.

dialogues.speaker: RUDY
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m just saying.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Her father did it. The son-of-a-bitchвЂ™s where he belongs now.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Jail? Casey leans in toward Vivien.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Hell.

dialogues.speaker: RUDY
dialogues.text: (to Vivien) Well, anyway, he killed himself right before the trial. They found him hanging. Completely naked.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Like I said, the fucking perv got what he deserved.

dialogues.speaker: RUDY
dialogues.text: But they never found her body. She--  56.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Give it up, Rudy.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Wait, they never found her?

dialogues.speaker: RUDY
dialogues.text: No! ThatвЂ™s the weird part. Vivien stares at Rudy, fascinated.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: So whereвЂ™d she go? WhatвЂ™s the theory?

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Fuck the theories.

dialogues.speaker: RUDY
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t know. Rudy points at Casey.

dialogues.speaker: RUDY
dialogues.text: His dad oversaw the whole thing. Casey SHUTS the yearbook. Sarah groans.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I was just looking at it! Jamie turns away, uneasy. Casey holds up his hands, the booze elevating him to elit asshole status.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Alright, enoughвЂ™s enough.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Casey.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Who wants another drink? Rudy raises his empty cup.

dialogues.speaker: RUDY
dialogues.text: I do! Casey grabs JamieвЂ™s shoulder.  57.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Come on, "Janie."

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Jamie, man. How many times I gotta say it? He follows Casey and Rudy to the wine/snacks table.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: DonвЂ™t get your panties in a wad. Vivien flashes Sarah a sly smile. EXT. LOUISEвЂ™S HOUSE - FRONT YARD - NIGHT Tall grass, rampant weeds. The abandoned cabin still remains, a shell of its former self. Shattered windows. Torn crime scene tape surrounds the busted-open doorway. KaneвЂ™s squad car parks near the porch. He steps out. An empty twelve-pack rests on the floorboard. Raising his flashlight, he makes his way toward the home. INT. LOUISEвЂ™S HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - NIGHT Crooked crucifixes line up along the walls, some of them lying on the floor. The lonely piano, its keys long broke stands near the busted T.V. Obscene carvings and spray-painted graffiti decorate the walls, phrases like KILLER, SICK FUCK, and BURN IN HELL. Empty longnecks pile up in the decrepit fireplace. Kane enters. He aims his flashlight through the rest of the room, illuminating cobwebs, dusty candles, and religious statue The beam hits the portrait of Louise. Her pictureвЂ™s beautiful eyes stare right at Kane. Kane catches a chill. He notices a bedroom door in a narr hallway. The piano KEYS play on their own, startling him.  58.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Shit! The MUSIC stops. Kane turns and looks back at the portrai He trembles, terrified. The picture now features a decomposing Louise. Blood flow from her eyes, dripping all down her face.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: LOUISE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: (praying) Father in Heaven. Kane whirls around, breathing heavy.

dialogues.speaker: LOUISE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: If tomorrow doesnвЂ™t come, I want you to know how much I love you. Kane retrieves his gun.

dialogues.speaker: LOUISE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: You have guided my steps today. His trigger finger shaking, Kane steps toward the bedroom door. LOUISEвЂ™S BEDROOM Antique furniture. Cobwebs dangle from the ceiling. Spide scurry across the peeling wallpaper. A canopy bed sits in the center of the room. Torn curtain encircle the large bed, disguising whatever lurks inside. ChrisвЂ™s camcorder rests on top of a monstrous dresser, lens pointed right at the bed.

dialogues.speaker: LOUISE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: And brought me home safely to my family. Kane walks inside, clinging to his flashlight and pistol.

dialogues.speaker: LOUISE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: You sing over me daily. Kane traces LouiseвЂ™s voice to the bed.  59.

dialogues.speaker: LOUISE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Thank you, Father. As Kane reaches toward the curtains, his flashlight cuts out. Total darkness. He stops, panicking.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: Goddammit !

dialogues.speaker: LOUISE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I love you. Amen. LouiseвЂ™s pale hand emerges from the curtains, snatching KaneвЂ™s wrist. Nerves ravage his psyche. He staggers back. Drops the flashlight.

dialogues.speaker: KANE
dialogues.text: No! Let go! The curtains part, revealing the gorgeous Louise. She sta up. Kane looks right into her ominous eyes. He stops fighting back, giving in to her. The flashlight cuts on, its beam so vivid and bright. Louise lets go. Gazing at her, Kane unbuttons his shirt. He strips down t his bare skin. Sits on the SQUEAKY mattress. Louise watches Kane jam the pistol upward into his mouth. Without remorse, Kane PULLS the trigger. Like water exploding from a whaleвЂ™s spout, the bullet S OUT the top of KaneвЂ™s head. Blood and grue decorate the curtains. Kane slumps back. Louise glares down at his corpse, nothing but contempt in her eyes. The camcorderвЂ™s red light goes out.  60.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Filthy. Dim lighting. Jamie checks his disheveled reflection.

dialogues.speaker: STALL
dialogues.text: Vile graffiti covers the wooden walls. Casey sits on the closed toilet, preparing a line of coke the metal toilet paper holder. He snorts the drug and lea back.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Whoo!

dialogues.speaker: BATHROOM
dialogues.text: Casey shoves the stall door open. The startled Jamie turns around. Casey waves him over.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Yo, you gotta try this shit! Jamie steps toward the bathroom door.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Naw, man, IвЂ™m good. Casey approaches Jamie, his footsteps loud and ominous.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Come on, youвЂ™re pussing out again, Janie.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: I said I didnвЂ™t want any. Jamie grabs the door handle. Casey snatches his wrist.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: What the fuck, man?

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: WhatвЂ™s gotten into you lately? We used to do this shit all the time! Jamie pushes him back.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: I canвЂ™t risk that, man! Casey cackles.  61.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Risk what?

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m not throwing everything away over that shit! It ainвЂ™t worth it. Jamie turns. Casey grabs him by the shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Fuck!

dialogues.speaker: STALL
dialogues.text: Casey throws Jamie against the seat. Jamie stares at another line, the white powder calling hi name. Casey blocks the doorway, taunting him.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Come on, Janie! Casey slaps Jamie upside the head.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: DonвЂ™t tell me youвЂ™re a scared little bitch again. Helpless, Jamie turns and faces Casey.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: I canвЂ™t. Casey hits him again, even more force this time.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Aw, fuck!

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: DonвЂ™t puss out on me, Jamie! Be a fucking man! Jamie leans in toward the drug.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Yeah! Jamie grabs the straw. Raises it over the powder.  62.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: There you go, buddy! Casey watches Jamie snort the coke.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Whoo! Now weвЂ™re talking! Jamie collapses against the stall. Casey performs a facetious slow-clap.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Jamie Tracy finally grew some balls, ladies and gentlemen. He pats the shaken Jamie on the back.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Yo, you alright? Jamie gives him a timid nod.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Alright. Casey pushes Jamie to the side.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: My turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivien and Sarah wait at the table. Sarah looks toward th bathrooms, growing restless.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Sheesh, whatвЂ™s taking them so long? She takes a sip from her cup. Vivien turns to see.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t know. Vivien stops and looks on, startled. She sees Al and Scrawny Woman hanging by the bathrooms. Sarah watches former CLASSMATES laugh and enjoy themselve on the dance floor.  63.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Ugh, he never wants to do anything. Just gets high and bitch. Al and Vivien make eye contact, AlвЂ™s harsh eyes glaring right at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CaseyвЂ™s sports car ZOOMS down the ruptured pavement. INT. CASEYвЂ™S SPORTS CAR - MOVING - NIGHT Casey controls the wheel. Sarah glares at him from the passengerвЂ™s seat.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You couldnвЂ™t do one song?

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Who cares? ItвЂ™s not like weвЂ™re missing anything. In the back, Vivien looks over at Jamie. He faces her, forcing a smile.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: The dance-offвЂ™s the funnest part.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m too fucked-up for that.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Yeah, no shit.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: (to Jamie) IвЂ™m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s okay. He looks out the window, concealing his emotions. They near the old high school.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: (to Casey) I bet we still wouldвЂ™ve won it too.  64. Casey turns up the RADIO, eager to overpower SarahвЂ™s complaining.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Probably embarrass ourselves.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, you took care of that on your own. Casey looks back out the windshield. Headlights illuminate Louise standing in the middle of th highway, a wild breeze whipping through her hair. Casey stares at her, stunned. Jamie sees her.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Aw, fuck!

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Jamie. Jamie leans forward, snagging CaseyвЂ™s shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Look out! Casey swerves the wheel, just avoiding Louise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cavernous, ominous woods encompass the property. Like a haunted castle, the abandoned school stands tall. CaseyвЂ™s sports car careens down the driveway. INT. CASEYвЂ™S SPORTS CAR - PARKED - NIGHT The stoic Casey cuts off the headlights. He snatches the keys out of the ignition.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Casey! CaseyвЂ™s blank eyes stare toward the school. Sarah reaches for him.  65.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What the Hell are you doing? Casey avoids her hand. He opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Is he okay?

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Hey, Casey. Sarah grabs CaseyвЂ™s shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Look at me, asshole! He sends her back with a harsh shove.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Ow! Casey! Casey steps out.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: What the fuck? The friends watch Casey SLAM the door.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Stupidass. Sarah opens the glove compartment and grabs a flashlight. Casey lumbers off toward a shattered classroom window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The eerie building awaits, its double door entrance resembling a barricade hiding sinister secrets. Sarah hops out the sports car. She points her flashlight toward the window. No oneвЂ™s there. Casey is gone.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Casey! Vivien and Jamie exit the vehicle. Sarah rushes toward the window, stepping over countless b cans.  66.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You better not be playing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boxes, filing cabinets, and crumbling student desks. A broken teacher desk sits in front of a busted whiteboard. Like Halloween decorations, ridiculous spiderwebs trickle down the windows and roof. Large holes cover the battered walls, revealing countless RODENTS and BUGS. Jamie, Vivien, and Sarah journey through.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Casey!

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: You think heвЂ™s trying to scare us?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: HeвЂ™s a sick dumbass, so yeah, probably. Jamie doesnвЂ™t say a word. He steps in a pile of dry vom

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Casey! They near the open doorway.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: It was like it wasnвЂ™t even him. He acted so weird.

dialogues.speaker: MAIN HALLWAY
dialogues.text: No windows. Rusty lockers and tall classroom doors align both sides. Smashed beer bottles and smudged cigarettes litter the cracked floor tile. Sarah shines the flashlight around, illuminating the desolate scene. TheyвЂ™re all alone.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Casey!

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Maybe we should go.  67.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: No! We need to find him. Vivien notices a black-haired porcelain doll lying on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: What in the world? She picks up the doll.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What? Vivien examines its cryptic appearance: gouged out eyes, ripped hair, dirt-smeared face. The others stare at it, disturbed by its appearance.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Creepy.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Yeah. Loud FOOTSTEPS echo down the hall. The startled Vivien drops the doll.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Oh God! The porcelain doll SMASHES against the brutal tile. Sarah rushes forward.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Casey! Vivien follows after her.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Sarah! The classroom door CREAKS. Jamie turns around, just in time to see the door SLAM shu

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Shit! Jamie grabs the handle. Locked. He SLAMS his fist against the wooden surface.  68.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Goddammit !

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Jamie! Further down the hall, more FOOTSTEPS echo toward Vivien Sarah. They scan the area. All the doors are closed.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Where are they? The frantic Sarah shines her light all over the place.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t see anything. The noises stop. Dead silence.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Shit. Loud BANGS RATTLE the lockers.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Oh God! Sarah points her light at the lockers. Some of the metal doors still SWING back-and-forth, but n oneвЂ™s around. Jamie stops next to Vivien and Sarah.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: The doorвЂ™s locked!

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What? Vivien runs toward one of the closed doors.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: WeвЂ™re fucking trapped! Vivien turns the locked doorknob.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Are you kidding me?

dialogues.speaker: LOUISE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: (praying) . Lord, bless daddy and keep him safe.  69. The terrified Jamie searches for Louise.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Aw, God! Vivien and Sarah look at him, confused.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Jamie, whatвЂ™s wrong?

dialogues.speaker: LOUISE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Lift your countenance upon him and give him peace. Jamie covers his ears.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Fucking stop! Vivien grabs his arm.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Jamie. Jamie confronts Vivien.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s Louise!

dialogues.speaker: LOUISE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: (whisper ) Jamie.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: You donвЂ™t hear her?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: No. Jamie, it canвЂ™t be.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s her! Sarah hears loud CREAKING.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Oh shit! She aims her flashlight down the hall and sees a narrow d SLAM shut. Sarah yanks VivienвЂ™s wrist.  70.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Come on!

dialogues.speaker: OFFICE
dialogues.text: Cramped. A large desk occupies the center of the room. Photographs and newspaper clippings lie on top of it. Nails and tacks pin snipped headlines and pictures to the walls. Sarah lets go of the doorknob, letting the door creep ope

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Casey? The group walk inside, Sarah illuminating the office with her flashlight. Casey isnвЂ™t there.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Shit, where is he? Sarah notices the pinned headlines. She stares at one, horrified. The bold font: Louise Lewton Declared Dead. The Search Fo Her Body Continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Underneath it rests a small black-and-white photo of Loui Her sophomore picture.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: YвЂ™all, come here.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: What is it? Her and Jamie see the clipping.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: (scared) Louise. Sarah moves the light toward the other clippings. All of them detail the same report. LouiseвЂ™s death. The disappearance of her body. A stack of photos and articles SLIDE off the desk, scarin the friends.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Oh God! Sarah leads Vivien to the spot.  71. Jamie looks at the wall, staring at a photo of Louise. Th picture shows her standing beneath a large tree. Her dres looks brand new, not torn and ragged. Sarah grabs a clipping off the desk. The headline: Rob Lewton Found Dead. Suicide By Hanging. Sarah covers her mouth, horrified. Vivien stares at RobвЂ™s photo. His scruffy beard and wil eyes.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Casey wouldnвЂ™t do this, would he?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t know. The trembling Sarah drops the article.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t think so. Jamie sees another picture of Louise. In the shot, an eight-year-old Louise holds a puppy.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: He wouldnвЂ™t just leave us like this. HeвЂ™d at least show up and laugh at us. Vivien rummages through the other articles. She glances a different photos of Rob with Louise.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: All these pictures and articles. He couldnвЂ™t have. Jamie looks back at the outdoor picture. Louise now stands a few feet away from the tree, closer toward the camera. A harsh glare replaces her neutral expression. Jamie stumbles back.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Fuck! The startled Vivien and Sarah turn and look at him.  72.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Jamie. Jamie faces them.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s Louise! ItвЂ™s her. SheвЂ™s doing this.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: SheвЂ™s dead!

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t know, but sheвЂ™s here! SheвЂ™s been following us this whole time!

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Babe, she couldnвЂ™t have. The disturbed Jamie turns. He look at the tree picture again. His eyes go wide in fear. Louise is gone.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Aw, God!

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Jamie. A cold hand snags JamieвЂ™s shoulder. He whirls around. Louise. Jamie stares into her haunting eyes. She leans in closer. The worried Vivien and Sarah look on. They only see Jamie

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: WhatвЂ™s he doing? The photographs and articles FLY off the desk.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Shit! Vivien and Sarah panic. They rush toward Jamie. Nails and tacks POP out, releasing the headlines and pictures.  73. Vivien pushes Jamie out of the room, helping him evade Louise.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Go! He turns and glimpses back. Louise is no longer there. The desk SLIDES across the room. The outdoor picture now lies on the floor. Louise is back it, standing closer toward the camera, a vivid slice runn across her neck.

dialogues.speaker: MAIN HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Jamie, Sarah, and Vivien leave the office, Vivien SLAMMIN the door behind them.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What the Hell happened back there?

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t know. Sarah staggers around, desperate.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Goddammit, Casey! Vivien looks at the quiet Jamie.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Jamie, what is this?

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: I already told you.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: They said sheвЂ™s dead!

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: SheвЂ™s alive! The weary Sarah leans against a locker.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Jamie, itвЂ™s-- From further down the hall, rapid FOOTSTEPS charge toward them.  74.

dialogues.speaker: VIVIEN
dialogues.text: Oh God! Sarah stands up. She points her flashlight that way, look for the culprit.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Casey! A door SWINGS open on its own. Sarah jumps back.
